snippet: Doctored photographs have a long history in Russia as political tools, but two or more parties can play the game in the Internet age.
abstract: Russia has a long tradition of using altered photographs as propaganda, with doctored prints routinely appearing in Soviet magazines, but Internet age has transformed practice; altered photo of leading opposition activist Aleksei Navalny incites Russian bloggers to turn tables on faux photograph by posting mock images of original print.
lead_paragraph: Doctored photographs have a long history in Russia as political tools, but two or more parties can play the game in the Internet age.

headline.seo: Smear Attempt Against Protest Leader Backfires in Russia
headline.main: Smear in Russia Backfires, and Online Tributes Roll In
headline.print_headline: Smear in Russia Backfires, And Online Tributes Roll In
